title.narrative: West Bengal Inland Water Transport, Logistics and Spatial Development Project

description.narrative: The project development objectives (PDO) are to (i) improve the efficiency and safety of passenger and freight movement across the Hooghly River; and (ii) establish a spatial planning framework to enhance accessibility within Kolkata Metropolitan Area.

condition.narrative: Legal Agreement: Schedule 2, Section I.B: The Borrower shall cause the PIE to; (i) ensure that the Project is carried out withdue regard to appropriate health, safety, social, and environmental practices and standards, and in accordance with the SafeguardDocuments; and (ii) refrain from taking any action which would prevent or interfere with the implementation of the SafeguardDocuments, including any amendment, suspension, waiver, annulment and/or voidance of any provision of the Safeguard Documents,whether in whole or part, without the prior written concurrence of the Bank.

Legal Agreement: Schedule 2, Section II.The Borrower shall cause the PIE to prepare, under terms of reference satisfactory to theBank, and furnish to the Bank no later than thirty-six (36) months from the Effective Date, a consolidated mid-term review reportfor the Project, in accordance with the provision of paragraph 2 of Section II of the Schedule to the Project Agreement.

Project Agreement: Schedule, Section I. C.The PIE shall ensure that the Sub-projects do not include any activities or expenditureson the negative list set forth in the ESMF. Except as the Bank shall otherwise agree in writing, the PIE shall ensure, and causeto ensure, that none of the provisions of the Safeguard Documents be abrogated, amended, repealed, suspended or waived. In case ofany inconsistencies between the provisions of any of the Safeguard Documents and the provisions of this Agreement and/or the LoanAgreement the provisions of the latter agreement(s) shall prevail.

Project Agreement: Schedule, Section I.A.The PIE shall; (i) maintain throughout the period of Project implementation, the ProjectSteering Committee, with composition, resources and terms of reference acceptable to the Bank, to provide overall advice and policydirections for Project implementation and monitoring Project implementation; (ii) maintain throughout the period of Projectimplementation, the Project Management Unit (“PMU”), set up within the WBTIDCL, headed by a Project Director assisted by competentstaff, all with experience and qualifications, in numbers and under terms of reference agreed with the Bank.

Project Agreement: Schedule, Section II.The PIE shall (i) monitor and evaluate the progress of the Project and prepare ProjectReports on the basis of indicators acceptable to the Bank, covering the period of one calendar semester, and shall be furnished tothe Bank not later than forty-five days after the end of the period covered by such report; and (ii) prepare, under terms ofreference satisfactory to the Bank, and furnish to the Bank no later than thirty-six (36) months from the Effective Date, aconsolidated mid-term review report for the Project, summarizing the results of the monitoring and evaluation activities carriedout from the inception of the Project, and setting out the measures recommended to ensure the efficient completion of the Projectand to further its objective.

Project Agreement: Schedule, Section III.(i) The PIE shall maintain, throughout Project implementation, and publicize theavailability of a grievance redress mechanism, in form and substance satisfactory to the Bank, to hear and determine fairly and ingood faith all complaints raised in relation to the Project and take all measures necessary to implement the determinations made bysuch mechanism in a manner satisfactory to the Bank,(ii) Without limitation to the provision of paragraph 1 above, no later thanone month after the Effective Date, the PIE shall establish a functional web-based grievance redress mechanism, in form andsubstance satisfactory to the Bank.

title.narrative: Percentage of reduction in travel distance for truck movement across the river for one representative route
Increased number of trucks on waterway on a selected route
Percentage passenger volume increase on selected ferry routes between Kolkata and Howrah (disaggregated by gender)
New, modern and safer vessels with gender inclusive design
Number of new and rehabilitated jetties with improved pontoons and gangways
Percentage of women recruited and trained as jalsaathis
Number of new and rehabilitated passenger terminals
Technical and non technical staff received at least 1 training program
Percentage female passenger volume increase on waterway
Number of routes for private sector ferry operations identified
Time reduction in passenger movement across the river on selected representative route between Howrah and Kolkata
Comprehensive Mobility Plan drafted and submitted for approval
Inclusive vessel designs (cater for women and for special needs)
Integrated Strategic Development Plan for IWT prepared and approved
Logistics Master Plan drafted and submitted for approval
Private capital mobilization for ro-ro vessel financing
Safety Management System established and implemented
Spatial Development Strategy drafted and submitted for approval
Spatial and mobility plans approved by the Minister in Charge
Completion and Adoption of an Institutional Strengthening and Business Plan

baseline.value: Weak sector capacity and internally conflicted institutional setup

target.value: The Transport Department has(a) 5-year IWT Institutional Strengthening and Business Plan(b) New vessel rules and regulations forthe operation of the ro-ro services (c) the vessel finance mechanism (d) clear mandate of the IWT Secretariat

actual.value: Weak sector capacity and internally conflicted institutional setup

title.narrative: Percent complaints resolved of the total complaints received using the dedicated helpline number and internet-based communication tools to report sexual harassment and GBV issues

target.value: At least 80 percent resolved out of total complaints received.
